title: BBC : 武裝暴徒衝入元朗站  路透社 :「三合會發動襲擊」

replies.msg:
大批穿着白衣人士周日在元朗西鐵站襲擊市民，引起外媒關注。英國廣播公司（BBC）把此新聞放在頭版，並描述施暴者為「武裝暴徒」（Armed mob）；路透社則描述施暴者為三合會成員（Triad gangster），並以此作題。

BBC頭版以「香港示威︰武裝暴徒衝入元朗站」（Hong Kong protests︰ Armed mob storms Yuen Long station）為題。

BBC首段以「數十名蒙面男子帶着鐵通周日衝入香港元朗站。」（Dozens of masked men armed with batons stormed a train station in the Hong Kong district of Yuen Long on Sunday. ）作引入。報道綜合了網民在網上發布的現場片段、香港政府的回應及香港警察的回應等。

路透社則以較大篇幅報道香港民主黨議員林卓廷的說法，並以「議員︰在香港晚上暴力示威活動後，三合會發動襲擊」（Triad gangster attack in Hong Kong after night of violent protests︰ lawmaker）為題。

美國有線電視新聞網絡（CNN）頭版則以「暴力之夜震驚了香港」（Night of violence shocks Hong Kong）為題，並附上一小段文字︰

防暴警察向示威者發射催淚氣體及橡皮子彈，手持鐵通的暴徒襲擊地鐵站的市民。

（Riot police fired tear gas and rubber bullets at protesters, and a mob armed with batons attacked people in a metro station.）

https://inews.hket.com/article/2407186

幫手推，宜家係關鍵時期動搖淺藍民意！

replies.msg:
一、以群眾鬥群眾，內耗消耗民意，
引起眾多火頭，燃起多條戰綫，力圖模糊最初目標，
大家要諗諗點拆

或者好似另外一啲巴絲講，
陰謀論諗，可能借無差別攻擊事件自製亂象，繼而自己修補亂象，
繼而挽回民望

二、另外大家可以 brainstorm 下：dress code 以顏色區分是否繼續可行？
如果著 smart casual 恤衫返工裝，
人人都係打工仔，人人都係 water，
到時打，打打工仔，打平民？

三、除 TVB 有免費 24 小時電視新聞頻道外，
ViuTV 同奇妙電視應該要同樣加開免費 24 小時電視新聞頻道，
本身兩台已有班底，只須加開頻道即可
甚至可考慮全港首創本地 24 小時英語新聞頻道
RTHK 31 亦要加強推廣自身頻道

同溫層講，大家都識得睇其他新聞，
但須知道好多酒樓、食肆冇嘢好播，咪播 TVB 新聞，
上年紀一輩只識打開對眼就睇

四、同樣唔可以忽視就係境外酒店電視落地，
大家打開酒店電視，睇香港嘅頻道，只會搵到 TVB，得 TVB 落到地，
呢方面要大家諗諗（外地人士第一觀感）
做新聞做到咁求撚其

replies.msg:
BBC全文：
Hong Kong protests: Armed mob storms Yuen Long station
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-49066982

The mob attack followed the latest pro-democracy rally in the centre of Hong Kong, where riot police had fired tear gas and rubber bullets at protesters.

It is unclear who the mob were, but they attacked passengers and people making their way back from the protest.

quote.msg:
大批穿着白衣人士周日在元朗西鐵站襲擊市民，引起外媒關注。英國廣播公司（BBC）把此新聞放在頭版，並描述施暴者為「武裝暴徒」（Armed mob）；路透社則描述施暴者為三合會成員（Triad gangster），並以此作題。

BBC頭版以「香港示威︰武裝暴徒衝入元朗站」（Hong Kong protests︰ Armed mob storms Yuen Long station）為題。

BBC首段以「數十名蒙面男子帶着鐵通周日衝入香港元朗站。」（Dozens of masked men armed with batons stormed a train station in the Hong Kong district of Yuen Long on Sunday. ）作引入。報道綜合了網民在網上發布的現場片段、香港政府的回應及香港警察的回應等。

路透社則以較大篇幅報道香港民主黨議員林卓廷的說法，並以「議員︰在香港晚上暴力示威活動後，三合會發動襲擊」（Triad gangster attack in Hong Kong after night of violent protests︰ lawmaker）為題。

美國有線電視新聞網絡（CNN）頭版則以「暴力之夜震驚了香港」（Night of violence shocks Hong Kong）為題，並附上一小段文字︰

防暴警察向示威者發射催淚氣體及橡皮子彈，手持鐵通的暴徒襲擊地鐵站的市民。

（Riot police fired tear gas and rubber bullets at protesters, and a mob armed with batons attacked people in a metro station.）

有需要請隨便借用：
有錯嘅話歡迎幫手改
Dear editor,
I really appreciate the news coverage on the mass assault happening in Hong Kong last night. However, there's one very important request that the Hong Kong people would like to send you:

We noticed that in the news you barely mentioned the identity of the attackers, and at the same time you so briefly summarised the identity of the victim as commuters.
(E.g. In the following extract:
'Hong Kong has been left in shock after a night of violence on Sunday which saw dozens of masked men storm a train station and attack commuters.')

Could you please make it *very clear* that the attackers were not the pro-democracy protesters? In fact, the attackers had been targeting mainly protesters in black clothes. And yes, later on non-protesters were attacked by the gangsters as well.

There's no confusion on this - if you need any source, there're tons available outside and I believe you would have the ability to accomplish the research and fact checking.

We don't want to see that the pro-democracy protestors, as part of the victims, would be wrongly perceived as the violent attackers by your readers because of the ambiguity in your news.

I sincerely hope that you could fufil the responsibility of a news company and report the truth to world.

Thank you so much for taking your time to read this message.
外遊警示啦 屌你老母

Dear editor,
I really appreciate the news coverage on the mass assault happening in Hong Kong last night. However, there's one very important request that the Hong Kong people would like to send you:

We noticed that in the news you barely mentioned the identity of the attackers, and at the same time you so briefly summarised the identity of the victim as commuters.
(E.g. In the following extract:
'Hong Kong has been left in shock after a night of violence on Sunday which saw dozens of masked men storm a train station and attack commuters.')

Could you please make it *very clear* that the attackers were not the pro-democracy protesters? In fact, the attackers had been targeting mainly protesters in black clothes. And yes, later on non-protesters were attacked by the gangsters as well.

There's no confusion on this - if you need any source, there're tons available outside and I believe you would have the ability to accomplish the research and fact checking.

We don't want to see that the pro-democracy protestors, as part of the victims, would be wrongly perceived as the violent attackers by your readers because of the ambiguity in your news.

I sincerely hope that you could fufil the responsibility of a news company and report the truth to world.

Thank you so much for taking your time to read this message.
